cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles west of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest parallel to the Baja California peninsula, then forecast to bend westward and weaken while remaining offshore of southern California
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central coast of the Baja California peninsula (near Punta Abreojos–San Jose de Las Palomas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Ensenada to the U.S./Mexico border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Punta Abreojos to San Jose de Las Palomas; Tropical Storm Warning Punta Abreojos southward to Cabo San Lucas and northward to Ensenada
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of the Baja California peninsula with swell extension into southern California
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty 20–30 kt winds possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large swells and rip currents; only minor coastal flooding possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 2–4 inches, potential localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas for vessel traffic due to long-period swells
